text: Canarium littorale is a tree found in tropical Asia and is a member of the incense tree family Burseraceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "of the seashore", referring to its habitat. ==Description== Canarium littorale grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . Its grey bark is smooth to scaly. The fruits are ellipsoid to ovoid and measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Canarium littorale grows naturally in Indo- China, Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Java and Borneo. Its habitat is forests from sea-level to altitude. ==References== littorale Category:Trees of Indo- China Category:Trees of Malesia Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Canarium littorale
